result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin Cody Weatherwax was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austin Cody Weatherwax is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austin Cody Weatherwax was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Austin Cody Weatherwax in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, $673.50 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Atty Dolch requesting fine/costs be stayed, Court requires counsel to notify court if change in appeal, Court stays sentence pending appeal,
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-11-2016 02:45 pm
Authorization to Appear filed by defendant

Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared for the defendant. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin, requested a warrant. Court authorized a warrant, stayed it until Monday at 4 p.m. If authorization filed, not guilty will be entered and place on trial calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-15-2015 02:45 pm
Defendant Austin Cody Weatherwax in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court denied defendant's motion to suppress.

Portage P.D. case notes page 16.

9:01 am Defendant Austin Cody Weatherwax in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stated called witness (Deputy M. Schutz).  Direct examination.  Cross examination. Witness excused 9:22 am.  9:22am  State called witness (Sargent B. Fehd).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Exhibit 1 marked, Portage P.D. case notes page 16, received by Court.  Witness excused 9:34am.  Closing arguments.  Rebuttal by State.  Response from Atty Raabe.  Court will take matter under advisement.  The speedy trial demand was rescinded.  Court found briefing is not necessary.  Oral ruling will was set.  Atty Raabe requested cell phone be returned to defendant.  No objection from State.  Court authorized the return of cell phone to defendant.  Atty Raabe will draft an order for Court to sign.  Oral ruling scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

9:31 Defendant Austin Cody Weatherwax in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requested the Motion by defense be more specific.  Argument by State and Defense.  Motion to Dismiss was denied by Court.  The Suppression Motion will be heard on 11-2-15 as scheduled.  9:37am
